Trial_Design.evidence: US cardiothoracic surgeons were then randomized to receive 1 clinical vignette

Participants.evidence: 515 African American patients (308 [59.8%] female; mean [SD] age, 66.2 [9.4] years)

Intervention.evidence: surgeons randomized to the vignette with African American race–corrected PFTs

Objective.evidence: Objectives: To identify how many hospitals providing lung cancer surgery use race correction

Method_Outcome.evidence: Main Outcomes and Measures: Number of hospitals using race correction in PFTs

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: US cardiothoracic surgeons were then randomized

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 225 surgeons (194 male [87.8%]; mean [SD] time in practice, 19.4 [11.3] years) were successfully randomized

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 515 African American patients (308 [59.8%] female; mean [SD] age, 66.2 [9.4] years) were included in the study

Result_Outcome.evidence: percent predicted preoperative FEV 1 and postoperative FEV 1 would have decreased by 9.2% (95% CI, −9.0% to −9.5%; P < .001)
